page.title: 13THE OLD PRIORY CHURCH/1
page.content: The ruins of the Old Priory Church stand at the north-east side of Holywood. The site was formerly occupied by a monastery dating about 640 A.D. It was destroyed by the Vikings in the ninth century. At the close of the twelfth century an Augustinian Abbey was built - the ruins are still to be seen in the churchyard today. In 1306 the church at "Haliwode" (early name) was valued at six marks which was equivalent of four pounds. Towards the end of the fifteenth century the Abbey of Holywood passed to Franciscan rule under which it remained until its dissolution by Henry VIII in 1541. In 1572 Sir Brian MacPhelim 0'Neill burnt the old Priory and it lay in ruins.
